attributes.action: cancel plans to create a database of all telephone calls made and emails sent by UK citizens within the draft Communications Bill
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Government is considering a database of all telephone calls made and emails sent in the UK under the banner of "Security." This is a Draconian step which would give the State more power than ever before to pry into the private lives of citizens. The State has no right to this information and the uses for such information in the name of "security" would be minimal. Add to that the State's inability to protect confidential information and we would be heading towards a situation where something which has been created to "protect" the citizenship would, in fact, become a threat.
